attributes.action: Bring 'Hands-on' STEM Back to Schools
attributes.background: As a STEM Educator and STEM Charity Owner, a important issue has come to light, that a lot of 'Hands-on' STEM skills have been stripped from young people's STEM education, leading to a large skill short-fall when student's carry on studying STEM subjects at university.
attributes.additional_details: Information about this subject has been collected and analysed by volunteers at GlamSci (www.GlamSci.org) whom are a non-profit STEM educational charity concerned with young people's education and rights to STEM subjects. This view is backed by current educational figures gathered by STEM governing bodies, universities and other educational organisations.

attributes.action: Prevent companies from defaulting the 'save payment information' on a website
attributes.background: Typically when purchasing online goods, companies by default check the 'Save these payment details'. Saving payment details online isn't a good thing and whilst the option should be there, it shouldn't be defaulted. This should be addressed and could potentially save people from fraudulent purchases
attributes.additional_details: Recently I was the victim of fraud as I may have mistakenly saved my payment card details on a website that was later compromised.

attributes.action: Give self-build eco-homes by local families automatic planning permission.
attributes.background: We live in a village and have outgrown our home. We bought a corner of a field close to the village centre to build an affordable Eco-home. This year 278 homes have been approved for building on fields within 2 miles of our site by commercial builders. Ours was refused. It's a double standard.
attributes.additional_details: Local Planning Authorities are supposed to be supporting self-builds, eco-homes, affordable homes and local people. Our LPA refused our application even though no measurable harm was established. High-impact commercial developments with big numbers of homes are favoured. This is wrong and is holding back the solution to the housing supply shortfall.

attributes.action: Make it Law for drivers involved in a accident to report to police at the scene
attributes.background: Drivers are able to leave the scene of an accident and be within the law to report it within 24 hours, therefore police are unable to take correct alcohol and drug samples, giving a possible lighter sentence.
attributes.additional_details: Ben regan was killed by a driver who failed to stop and drove home and hid the car, and called the police 10 hours after, to plead not guilty to a careless driving charge due to lack of evidence. Family's are being put through hell because of this loophole. It must be stopped.

attributes.action: Make it an arrest-able offence for protesters to obstruct roads of any kind
attributes.background: As people are aware protesters come in all different forms and from different beliefs. For those who chose to protest in roads whether it be a side road, entrance to a work sight, or a main road. This is petition is to help make it an arrest-able offence to block roads of any kind.
attributes.additional_details:
Helping stop protesters obstructing roads and access of the road; by making it an arrest-able offence to cause obstruction or disruption too any road of any kind.
This could help prevent companies suing or losing business and increase awareness for road safety and the dangers of protesters using main roads or side roads of any kind.

attributes.action: Reinstate George Osborne's plan to set up a 2nd hand annuity market
attributes.background: People have been waiting nearly two years to be able to sell their poor monthly payments for cash lump sums where they can make a difference to their lives.   For example, I've sat with no working boiler as I can't afford one without my annuity funds in one payment.

attributes.action: Eliminate residency requirements when determining a British Citizens fee status
attributes.background: As a British citizen, one can expect fair and just treatment in their country; one should not be treated any differently than fellow Britons. Currently, a citizen must live in the UK for the 3 year before starting a university course, which discriminates against citizens who live abroad.
attributes.additional_details: With the current fee status terms, many British citizens are classified as international students when returning to their home. Not only are international fees extortionate, this means that a citizen is treated no differently than a foreigner when they are in their own country. These fees may even impede a citizen from returning home. In order to end this discrimination, fee status should be based upon citizenship; a Briton should be considered a Briton, regardless of where s/he has lived.

attributes.action: To create separate employment laws for big businesses & micro/small businesses.
attributes.background: Corporate law does not recognise that small business cannot afford to offer the same 'rights' as big business, such as lengthy paid maternity/paternity leave etc. However, it can offer a more rewarding work environment, where every employee is an individual who is vitally important to the business.
attributes.additional_details: Because every person counts in a small business, it cannot afford to lose an employee for extended periods and pay cover. But by choosing to work in a micro/small business, employees could opt for shorter paid maternity/paternity leave, fewer paid sick days etc. in exchange for other benefits such as greater flexibility in working time & time off. Plus an environment where each employee is vitally important to the success of the business and there is greater equality between the boss and staff.

attributes.action: Allow the continued use of A2 motorcycle restrictor kits.
attributes.background: The plan to prohibit current use of A2 restrictor kit seems unfair to a lot of riders as this is a step up for their current A1 licence restricting the to 125cc motorcycles. The UK is one of the strictest if not the strictest when it comes to motorcycle laws,this is a step in the wrong direction.

attributes.action: Halt the Department of Education's Autumn Census & destroy all data collected.
attributes.background: The Department of Education's Autumn Census expects parents to disclose their children Country of Birth and state 'National Identity' from a list of Welsh, English, Scottish, Irish, British, Other, or Refuse. Parents should not be asked to determine and disclose the national identity of children.

attributes.action: Make Wildlife/ natural history a compulsory part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: Wildlife around the globe is decreasing at a ferocious rate, not just oversea but on our very own soil. By educating generations about the value of wildlife, the ecosystem and what animals do for us, only then will the world halt the decline in our amazing Wildlife.
attributes.additional_details:
An audit of more than 200 native species - including birds, bats, moths, butterflies, hares and dormice - shows that priority species have declined on average by 58% since 1970 - The guardian

 “The natural world is in serious trouble and it needs our help as never before.”  Sir David Attenborough

attributes.action: Increase the number of specialist road traffic officers to reduce road deaths
attributes.background: 10,732 people died on UK roads between 2010 and 2015. In the period Jan to March 2016 alone saw a 14% increase in reported road deaths. Without the fear of detection, non-compliance of road safety rules and laws is noticeably increasing. Enforcement is no longer supporting education or engineering
attributes.additional_details:
"The level of enforcement on our roads is woefully inadequate, 
between 2010 and 2014 the UK has seen a 27% reduction in the number of specialist road traffic police on the roads (falling from 5,338 to 3,901) outside of London". Brake-the road safety charity
Without a visible police presence, road users no longer fear being caught and are increasing non-compliant and yet detection rates are falling
Between 2010-15 133,565 people were seriously injured
Motor insurers paid out £27m per day in 2015

attributes.action: Justice for children. Tougher prison sentences for paedophiles, 15 years minimum
attributes.background: Paedophiles are protected by an out of date legal system. They are protected in prison and given a new identity once free. A paedophile or sex offender never truly faces their disgusting crimes, while the children and families have to deal with it forever.
attributes.additional_details: Paedophiles should be forced to mix with the general population of a prison - why should they be kept safe? A child will never be able to forget what they have been through, while the paedophiles are set free after a few years to do it to another child. How can parents protect their children from a paedophile when they are so well hidden?

attributes.action: Policy of UK to not officially join a coalition for military action in Syria.
attributes.background:
The USA seems to be considering building a coalition to take military action in Syria.  The UK Parliament has already voted to NOT take military action in Syria.

It should be UK Government Policy not to take military action in Syria.

attributes.action: Lower voting age in the North of Ireland from 18 to 16.
attributes.background: We, as young people, demand that the British Government allow people over the age of 16 in the North of Ireland to exercise their right to vote in elections.
attributes.additional_details:
MLAs in the Assembly endorsed a joint Sinn Féin and Green Party motion in 2012 backing the lowering of the voting age from 18 to 16. 

This process will allow young people to fully engage with local politics and also their local communities. It's vital that young people have a voice in deciding the course of their future.

attributes.action: Any referendum on Scottish independence should require a 75% majority to succeed
attributes.background: If Scottish independence is declared with a tiny majority, then there will not be sufficient support to make it workable and it will set the people of Scotland against each other. For independence to succeed, there needs to be a substantial majority in favour.
attributes.additional_details: Based upon the result of the previous referendum and opinion polls since, the indication is that if, in the unlikely event of a vote going the way of independence, it will be with a tiny majority. For something as important as this issue, a substantial majority is required to make independence workable. Ideally, this should be at least 75%. This is a fair figure. Once abstentions are taken into account, a 75% majority would show the clear will of the people.

attributes.action: Why stop child tax credits and penalise working parents?
attributes.background: I feel the government are making my decision for me in having more children by stopping tax credits. I have 3 children at the moment and would like one more but I cant afford the childcare without assistance, like many other parents.
attributes.additional_details:
Childminders and nurseries will suffer as a result of less children being born. We will need less midwives and health visitors as case loads will be smaller. 
Also with the reduced earnings, for nurseries and childminders because of the new 30 free hours a week for 2 and 3 year olds.
If both parents are working fulltime then we should be able to claim this still for however many children we can afford to feed, clothe and house.

attributes.action: Change the rules of voting so that you have to vote in permanent ink.
attributes.background: There has been complaints in the past that voting in pencil can leave our votes open to being changed, as pencil marks can get erased, but if we vote in permanent ink, people will be more confident that their vote will count, so more people will be encouraged to vote.

attributes.action: Agree new pay and benefits deal with emergency services. Then let country vote.
attributes.background: Agree deal with all emergency services and then let the public vote if we want to pay that much to protect us. Today and many other times show we need them more now than ever. It's time for people to say that we are willing to reward them properly.
attributes.additional_details: Finally give all the emergency services a financial package they deserve, that they agree is fair. Today has finally impacted MPs directly. This interferes with some public on a daily basis. The efficiency of our services on a regular basis needs the reward in the times we live in now. We had a country vote on Brexit, I suggest we now agree a deal with the emergency services that they are happy with. Then put a vote to the country to agree to pay for this. We need them in these times more than ever. Let us show them what they mean to all of Great Britain.

attributes.action: Tell Parliament the real Brexit cost
attributes.background: We call on David Davis, the Brexit Secretary, to provide monthly reports to parliament on the real cost of Brexit with effect from April 2017.
attributes.additional_details:
This should at least include:
- actual direct costs (bills incurred by Government), 
- actual indirect costs (the cost of re-allocating Government resources), 
- estimated businesses' costs (cost of new red tape, tariffs, hiring costs) and 
- estimated individuals' costs (higher inflation, higher taxes or reduced public services to pay for Brexit)
- any other direct or indirect cost that Parliament believes is relevant

Both direct and estimated costs should be independently audited.

attributes.action: Incentivise large retailers to prioritise local products over imports
attributes.background: Our local Tesco store in Suffolk has recently stopped stocking UK sugar which is packaged just across the road. Help regional economies by regulating the sale of imported products that directly compete with local products.
attributes.additional_details:
Local newspaper article:
http://www.eadt.co.uk/news/tesco_drops_the_suffolk_produced_silver_spoon_sugar_in_favour_of_rival_1_4919328

Farmer's Weekly article:
http://www.fwi.co.uk/news/farmer-anger-as-tesco-ditches-british-sugar.htm

Other example of imports over UK products:
https://www.theguardian.com/business/2016/mar/20/uk-supermarkets-urged-to-stock-more-british-lamb

Interesting charitable organisation working with businesses on future sustainability:
www.forumforthefuture.org

attributes.action: Government build more new affordable council housing to stop ever higher rents.
attributes.background: More & more people are having to rent privately & rents are far to high for most people & taxpayers money is going to private landlords who keep their housing benefit tenants in slum-like conditions. This must stop. If there was more council housing rents would come down.
attributes.additional_details:
One million homes in the private rented sector fail to meet basic standards of safety, warmth and repair, a report reveals.

Billions of pounds of taxpayers' money is being spent on housing benefit for rent given to private landlords who fail to keep the properties in good condition. The money would be better spent on build new council housing.

attributes.action: I think that horse owners should have to pick up after their pets.
attributes.background: When you are walking or cycling down a path nothing is more disturbing than a big pile of horse excrement.
attributes.additional_details: I know its not as bad as dog feaces but it is no more pleasant it is unavoidable when on a bike and from my experiences does not clear up very quickly. I think that if a horse owner wants to keep a horse they should be prepared to pick up after them! Instead they are lazy and leave their horses waste in the way of cyclists, walkers, children and other animals.

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of content required to know by A level students
attributes.background: Within the A level course, students are required to learn a significant amount of content, however this is causing problems as the level of work is exceeding the practical capability of the pupils.
attributes.additional_details: This is causing a large amount of stress and students are finding it increasingly difficult to obtain their expected grades and retain all the knowledge required.

attributes.action: Send Help For African Droughts
attributes.background: Today, as you are reading this, droughts in Africa are happening, I want your to sign this petition so we can send help to these dying people, everyday children and adults die in Somalia, and there are many more in other countries, no food or not a lot of water, they will not survive!

attributes.action: Build a new Royal Yacht Britannia
attributes.background:
Following the EU referendum, we should build a new Royal Yacht Britannia using British Steel, British Workers and training British apprentices.

Britannia would be a Flag Ship for a newly invigorated Britain sailing the oceans of the world promoting the UK globally as a free trading nation.
attributes.additional_details: This is a perfect opportunity to invest British money in a project that will create British jobs, train British apprentices and produce a fully British product. The Royal family will once again be able to showcase British engineering and design at its best whilst visiting countries all over the world establishing and building relationships that will pave the way for trade deals with our Global partners.

attributes.action: Stop the capture and collection of live, wild caught wrasse.
attributes.background: The taking of wild ballan wrasse to use within the cage culture of salmonid species is detrimental to the UK coastal environment. It takes on average 6 years for a ballan to reach sexual maturity and collecting and taking them from the wild can have long term negative impacts.

attributes.action: Scotland must hold a referendum on whether to rerun the independence referendum.
attributes.background: The raisin d'etre of the Scottish Nationalist Party (SNP) is for an independent Scotland & so it's likely to repeatedly trigger Independence referenda until it gets this. It is crucial that such potentially destabilising referenda are only held when the majorIty of Scotts want them.
attributes.additional_details: The best way to prove that a majority of Sottish people want to hold a further independence referendum is to put this question to them at an initial referendum.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to raise taxes while our overseas aid exceeds £5billion
attributes.background: The UK tax payers are fed up with the reckless overseas spending of the British tax payer's money while our own country is in an abysmal decline. Our front line services are failure, our roads are failing, our aged care is failing. Tax is increasing at a rate it is now causing people harm.
attributes.additional_details: The UK people are fed up with being the cash cow of Europe.  The UK is financing the unemployed throughout Europe. Road building projects throughout Europe with Portugal being a prime example.  The Aged care in the UK is a joke beyond belief. Yet the UK sends millions to China for their care system. This now needs to end.  It's the very hard labour of the British tax paying people keeping politicians in jobs that sole structure is to hand out the UK's tax payers cash.

attributes.action: Make sexual harassment punishable with a fine or prison sentence.
attributes.background: Currently within the UK, at least 90% of women have experienced some form of sexual harassment before the age of 17. Sexual harassment is not has emotionally damaging affects but it continually exacerbates the ideal that men have power over women and impedes women's societal right to be equal to men
attributes.additional_details: Sexual harassment can range from anything from "cat calling" and "wolf whistling" to inappropriate physical contact and unwanted sexual advances. So many women nowadays feel as though they are unable to report it but it has profound psychological and social effects on women every day. It continues to objectify women even to this day. Due to the little reports our national figures are majorly unrepresentative of the life women live daily. Enough is enough. Stand with the 2010 Equality Act.

attributes.action: HGV stay in the inside lane between 6am to 8pm on motorways and dual carriageway
attributes.background: I feel a lot of the congestion caused is by one lorry overtaking another lorry and taking miles to do so , making lorries keep to the inside lane would ease a lot of this it would also save the government and the county a fortune as a lot of the road widening schemes would not be necessary ,

attributes.action: 45p/mile Mileage Allowance Payment for walking or cycling for business journeys
attributes.background: The current permitted Mileage Allowance Payment for business travel for the first 10,000 miles for bicycles are less than half the allowance for cars, while there is no tax refund for walking to your local business meeting instead of taking your car.
attributes.additional_details: This would encourage businesses to adopt greener transport and does not need expensive infrastructure and costly enforcement departments.  Firstly, it would incentivise employees to walk or cycle instead of taking their cars for very short journeys; thereby increasing national physical activity levels, improving health, and reducing obesity rates. Secondly, it could reduce the number of vehicles used for short business journeys; thereby reducing congestion and reducing pollution.

attributes.action: Standardisation of community first responders in the united kingdom.
attributes.background: Community First Responders are members of the public, trained by the Ambulance Service Trusts, who volunteer their time to respond to 999 calls on behalf of Ambulance Service Trusts throughout the UK. They provide medical and life saving help to patients in emergency situations.
attributes.additional_details:
That First Responders are formally recognised and known as “Ambulance First Responders” by all Ambulance Service Trusts.
That all First Responders are permitted to bear the title “Ambulance First Responder” on their uniforms and response vehicles.
That all First Responders are permitted to wear uniforms in the same green colours of Ambulance Services Trust personnel while responding.
Training is reviewed and standardised across the all Ambulance Services Trusts in the UK.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for any school to detain SEN Children after school
attributes.background: As a mum of an SEN Child and a person that works in a school, I feel passionately about this. SEN children, whatever their needs, have had enough to cope with after 6 hours at school. They have worked 4 times as hard as the other kids.

attributes.action: Statutory Adoption Allowance for Self-Employed
attributes.background:
Employed people who adopt are entitled to the same 39 weeks paid leave as those who give birth.
Self Employed parents are entitled to 39 weeks maternity allowance. Which amounts to £5,443.62.
A Self Employed parent who adopts receives no statutory allowance.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst some parents may be able to contact the local authority for help this is not in any way guaranteed.
As part of the adoption procedures the prospective parents have their finances inspected and so the majority of parents are reluctant to ask for financial help in fear that it jeopardises their application

attributes.action: Require visas for visitors to the UK & add a fee if they've no health insurance.
attributes.background: The fees raised for the visas should be used to off set the cost to the NHS for providing treatment to the visitors.

attributes.action: GCSE students receive a letter grade instead of a number grade for all subjects
attributes.background: For many years, GCSE students have received a letter grade instead of a number grade, so hanging it is inconvenient and confusing. It would be hard to tell what grade is good and Universities will find this a challenge.
attributes.additional_details: This change would be made for all subjects, including the core subjects, to simplify the grading system and stop and confusion.

attributes.action: Bring in a standard size/height for speed bumps so cars can be designed to suit
attributes.background:
Speed bumps vary in height and width all over the country. 
Bringing in a standard will allow car manufacturers to design cars to suit. This will not just be cost effective but also safer for pedestrians.

attributes.action: Delay Article 50 until impact of Brexit is clear, then consult the people again.
attributes.background: The question oversimplified the issue and was open to interpretation. The Government took the result as a mandate to exit at any cost. A "hard Brexit" will damage the economy and may break up the UK. The result was too close to justify this. Opinion polls suggest a different result if run today.
attributes.additional_details:
A recent ITV poll suggests that 12% of people would change their vote if the referendum was run again. This exceeds the margin of the Leave result in the Referendum
http://www.itv.com/news/update/2017-02-17/how-do-you-feel-about-brexit-vote-now/

attributes.action: Condemn the murderous attacks on the elected Leader of the Bakongo people.
attributes.background: The mandate of the current government expired on 19 December 2016. After 16 years Hyppolite Kanambe alias Joseph Kabila refuses to relinquish power and must be held accountable for the murder of un-armed civilians by Police and soldiers ultimately under his control.
attributes.additional_details: There is photographic evidence of the slaughter of un-armed civilians at the residence of The Honourable Muanda Nsemi  an elected government deputy. Currently his home is under siege with all amenities cut. At his residence there are the elderly, women and children who went there to pray. I have information that the situation is deteriorating and risks to human life is high. We want the International community to intervene to save the lives of the People of Congo. It is Imperative to act now.

attributes.action: Fund a working replica of Captain James Cook's Endeavour  and a Botanical Centre
attributes.background: Middlesbrough born Capt. James Cook discovered Botany Bay. 200yrs later the town produced the steel for the Sydney Harbour Bridge.
attributes.additional_details: In 2032 Australia will celebrate the 100th  anniversary of  the bridge. It will and has generated an enormous revenue into the country's economy. Middlesbrough should also be recognised. It will help the local economy if it becomes a place of  interest. This investment should form part of the Government's action plan published on 26th August 2016 to invest £40 million into tourism: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-invests-40-million-and-cuts-red-tape-to-boost-tourism-across-england

attributes.action: Save Southport A&E hospital
attributes.background:
Southport A&E hospital is on a list for closing. Think about it..... if you or your family needed emergency care where and how long would it take to get there never mind about being in the nhs queue to receive treatment. 
Please help everyone you know. Let's save southport A&E!!!!!!!

attributes.action: Charge the US for additional security measures needed for Donald Trumps UK Visit
attributes.background: Donald Trump will be making a state visit sometime soon, despite nearly 2 Million UK residents opposing it. The estimated cost of additional security for the visit is over £1Million- the U.K. Police forces / Tax Payers shouldn't be expected to foot this bill. The US should support the cost.
attributes.additional_details: Donald Trump will be making a state visit sometime soon, despite nearly 2 Million UK residents opposing it. The estimated cost of additional security for the visit is over £1Million- the U.K. Police forces / Tax Payers shouldn't be expected to foot this bill. The US should support / cover the cost. Our NHS is struggling, as are the other emergency services.

attributes.action: Don't jail journalists for publishing documents deemed harmful to the economy
attributes.background: Under new proposals for an Espionage Act to replace the Official Secrets Act journalists could be jailed for 14 years for obtaining or publishing anything that could be deemed harmful to our economy. This is against democracy, undermines journalism and its role of checking powers.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/02/11/journalists-obtain-leaked-official-material-could-sent-prison/

attributes.action: Make stolen motorcycle information freely available to the public.
attributes.background: Information pertaining to stolen powered two wheelers should be freely available. Registration numbers, VIN numbers and engine numbers of all vehicles reported stolen should be available on a free to use Government website with the aim of reducing theft by making stolen PTW's harder to sell.
attributes.additional_details: In the period Jan-15 to Mar-15, 6574 PTW's were reported as stolen (source www.met.police.uk/foi/pdfs/disclosure_2016/may_2016/2016030001373.pdf)  Many of these, especially in the London area have been used in robberies of individuals and shops.  As information on stolen PTW's is already available on pay to use sources, I would like to request that information held by Govt. agencies regarding theft status, colour changes and insurance history (e.g. write offs) be made freely available.

attributes.action: Make law that parents are financially accountable for their childrens behaviour
attributes.background: Parents have a duty to bring up our children to be good law abiding citizens. But laws do not encourage this, a child can be brought up an cause, criminal damage, theft and even hospitalise people without any come back on the parents. Adults need to be accountable for parenting performance.
attributes.additional_details: Poorly brought up children cost the country and tax payers a vast amount of money. Graffitti alone in London last year cost over £100m, criminal damage, theft and crimes relating to injury should all hold the parents financially accountable. Criminal damage by children is not paid for by the parents, so insurance goes up. Unless the laws of this country encourage the outcome we want then some parents will continue to perform badly as parents and future generations will suffer.

attributes.action: Referendum for the public to decide how the pension age should be set
attributes.background: The government has decided the pension age should be increased due to people living longer, the public have had no say in this so I would suggest a referendum to decide what a fair pensionable age would be in the U.K.

attributes.action: Increase income tax & CGT by 1% then raise NHS spending by 10%
attributes.background: It has become overwhelmingly apparent to the electorate that the NHS is struggling to function with many people left bedridden in corridors, operations cancelled and lifesaving treatments being denied to those most in need.
attributes.additional_details:
With 2015 total tax receipts being £533bn of which 56% is raised through Income Tax, NI & CBT. We believe a 1% raise on the 3 tiers of income tax as well as CGT will raise sufficient funding to increase spending on our NHS by no less than 10%. 

Government Tax Receipts:
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/539194/Jun16_Receipts_NS_Bulletin_Final.pdf 

NHS Deficit:
https://www.kingsfund.org.uk/publications/deficits-nhs-2016

attributes.action: Allow parents to use tax-free childcare vouchers to increase schools funding
attributes.background:
Schools funding in England is at a critical low - some are threatening a 4-day week to reduce the financial deficit.  This will profoundly affect our children's education.  
My local school receives just £15.16 per child per day.  It is not enough to cover even basic teaching requirements.
attributes.additional_details:
The idea:
Many working parents like me pay into a childcare voucher scheme for under-5s, where up to £243 per month can be used tax-free towards nursery.  
The government should extend this scheme so that is continues for working parents of over-5s and their schools. 
This means that if parents choose, and are able to make a voluntary financial donation to a school, it is not taxed; thus helping to fill the funding gap.

attributes.action: Increase inheritance tax to 95% on inheritance of assests or property.
attributes.background: Im really rich, but feel others should have a good opportunity in life too.
